 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דּוּרָא‎</span> **proper name, of a location** ==near Babylonia==, only <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בִּקְעַת ד‎</span> [[Dan.3.1|Dan 3:1]], [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]]. <span class="bdbLangGreek">τοῦ περιβόλου</span> (Syro-Hex. <span class="bdbLangGreek">περίβολον</span>), <span class="bdbLangGreek">Θ Δεειρα</span>; ***Dûru*** is name of several places in Babylonia [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>Par. 216</sup>; [[BDB#Baer|Baer]]<sup>Dn. p. x</sup>, compare [[BDB#Andr|Andr]]<sup>M 58</sup>\*; [[BDB#Hoffm|Hoffm]]<sup>Pers. Märtyrer 164 f.</sup>; name of small river and mounds [[BDB#Opp|Opp]]<sup>Expéd. i. 238 f.</sup> (see [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]); improbably explained as = <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***zôr***</u></abbr>, ***depression*** (name actually used of lower Euphrase and Tigris valleys) by [[BDB#Wetzst|Wetzst]]<sup>De Jes:3 701 f.</sup>; Babylonian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***dûru***</u></abbr> = ***wall.***
